TextView.android:text: Fahrenheit (symbol F)is a temperature scale based on one proposed in 1774 by the German physicist Daniel Gabriel Fahrenheit(1686 -1736), after whome the scale is named. Celsius, also known as Centegrade, is a scale and unit of measurement for temperature. It is named after the Swedish Scientist Anders Celsius(1701-1744), who developed a similar temperature scale. Temperature is the measure of the average random molecular kinetic energy in a substance.
